intro: Palicourea paujilensis, commonly known as the Paujil plant, is a climbing shrub native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental and medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
